intro: Croton vervaetii, commonly known as the Vervaetii croton, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful leaves. The plant features showy, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate and can vary in shape, sometimes with a waxy texture. Croton vervaetii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
